title: South Dakota girl urges Obama to visit her hometown - CNNPolitics.com
text: Obama greets the nation 01:16 PLAY VIDEO Rebecca is a resident of Vermillion, South Dakota, and has apparently been waiting for the President to visit her state for six years. RELATED: 'Saving the best for last': Obama visits 50th state as President with South Dakota stop The White House tweeted a picture of a letter that Rebecca addressed to the President, urging him to visit South Dakota and sweetening the pot by reminding him "we are the warmest of the Dakotas, we have Mt. Rushmoore, and when I just go to the park I sometimes see coyotes, hawks, and bald eagles." Rebecca drew a picture of a broken heart and wrote "This is my heart because you haven't visited South Dakota." She even signed the letter with "Sadly, Rebecca," adding another broken heart and a sad face for emphasis. During his trip, President Obama will visit the Lake Area Tech Community College in Watertown to deliver a commencement address. Rebecca's heart can officially mend when President Obama visits South Dakota tomorrow â†’ http://t.co/Cm9KnTEfDR pic.twitter.com/FNsposqhaT
